intro: Lastrea philippina, commonly known as the Philippine lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland forests and secondary vegetation. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish in color and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has traditional medicinal uses in local communities for treating various ailments.
